```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(CausalGrid)
```

Let's get some fake data
```{r}
N = 1000
X = matrix(rnorm(N), ncol=1)
d = rbinom(N, 1, 0.5)
tau = as.integer(X[,1]>0)
y = d*tau + rnorm(1000, 0, 0.0001)
```

Here's how you use the package
```{r}
est_part = fit_estimate_partition(y, X, d)
```
